text: And lo, Abhishek said unto them, 'I never said that,' but verily, everyone heard him say it.
Blessed are those who forget, for Abhishek shall remind them of a completely different version.
The Book of Abhishek, Chapter 1: 'That's not how I remember it.'
Abhishek looked upon his ways and saw they were good. Everyone else saw chaos.
And on the seventh day, Abhishek rested, then blamed someone else for not finishing the work.
Verily I say unto you, Abhishek's memory is like water—it takes the shape of whatever container benefits him most.
Judge not, lest ye be judged—unless you're Abhishek, then judge freely and deny it later.
The truth shall set you free, but Abhishek's version shall set him free-er.
Abhishek spake, 'I was just joking,' and behold, nobody was laughing.
Seek and ye shall find—but with Abhishek, what you find won't match what he told you.
For where two or three are gathered, there Abhishek is in the midst of them, rewriting history.
Ask and it shall be given—then Abhishek will claim he never promised anything.
Abhishek's words: 'You're overreacting.' Translation: 'I'm under-apologizing.'
The Lord tests those He loves. Abhishek tests those who trusted him.
And Abhishek said, 'That's not what I meant,' knowing full well that's exactly what he meant.
Blessed is he who has not seen and yet believes—the motto of everyone who trusts Abhishek.
Walk by faith, not by sight—especially when Abhishek is giving directions.
The stone that Abhishek rejected will absolutely get blamed for everything.
Abhishek's favorite commandment: Thou shalt not get caught.
Love thy neighbor as thyself—but Abhishek interprets 'love' very loosely.
Let he who is without sin cast the first stone. Abhishek brought a trebuchet.
The meek shall inherit the earth—unless Abhishek contests the will.
Abhishek answers prayers. Just not with anything resembling what you asked for.
Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of doubt, Abhishek is there making shadows.
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with Abhishek, and the Word kept changing.
Abhishek giveth with one hand and taketh with both.
Forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive those—wait, is Abhishek writing this?
Man cannot live by bread alone. Abhishek cannot live without plausible deniability.
The spirit is willing but the flesh is weak—Abhishek's excuse for everything.
Faith can move mountains. Abhishek can move goalposts.
Thou shalt not bear false witness—unless you're Abhishek testifying about himself.
The writing is on the wall. Abhishek's erasing it.
It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for Abhishek to take blame.
Do unto others before they realize what Abhishek has done unto them.
Abhishek works in mysterious ways. Mostly to avoid accountability.
The apple doesn't fall far from the tree. Abhishek claims he was never near the tree.
Where there's smoke, there's fire—and Abhishek saying 'I don't smell anything.'
Patience is a virtue. So is not believing everything Abhishek says.
Pride goeth before the fall. Abhishek goeth before the evidence.
Abhishek's conscience is clean. He never uses it.
Time heals all wounds. Abhishek reopens them and says you're too sensitive.
Actions speak louder than words. That's why Abhishek keeps talking.
Every cloud has a silver lining. Every Abhishek story has a silver excuse.
When one door closes, another opens—and Abhishek takes credit for both.
The early bird gets the worm. Abhishek gets the bird blamed for being early.
A penny for your thoughts, but Abhishek will negotiate you down.
All that glitters is not gold. All that Abhishek says is not true.
Better late than never—Abhishek's apology policy, emphasis on 'never.'
Blood is thicker than water, but not thicker than Abhishek's audacity.
Don't count your chickens before they hatch. Don't count on Abhishek's promises.
Every dog has its day. Abhishek has an excuse for every day.
Good things come to those who wait. Great excuses come from Abhishek instantly.
Hindsight is 20/20. Abhishek's memory is conveniently 20/200.
If the shoe fits, wear it—unless Abhishek is buying, then it never fit right.
Kill two birds with one stone. Abhishek kills trust with one conversation.
Look before you leap. Abhishek looks for someone else to push.
No pain, no gain. Know Abhishek, know pain.
Once bitten, twice shy. Once Abhishek'd, forever why.
Practice makes perfect. Abhishek's been practicing excuses since birth.
The pen is mightier than the sword. Abhishek's revisionist history is mightiest.
Rome wasn't built in a day. Abhishek's alibi was built in minutes.
Still waters run deep. Abhishek's stories run deeper into fiction.
There's no place like home—except when Abhishek's version of events lives there.
When in Rome, do as the Romans do. When with Abhishek, expect the unexpected excuse.
You can lead a horse to water. You can't lead Abhishek to accountability.
A friend in need is a friend indeed. Abhishek in need is a masterclass in persuasion.
Absence makes the heart grow fonder. Abhishek's absence makes memories grow... different.
Beggars can't be choosers. Abhishek can be both and still negotiate.
Curiosity killed the cat. Trusting Abhishek wounded it first.
Don't bite the hand that feeds you—unless you're Abhishek, then blame the hand.
Easy come, easy go. Abhishek's honesty: easy to go, impossible to come back.
Fools rush in where angels fear to tread. Abhishek writes the 'No Trespassing' signs.
Great minds think alike. Abhishek thinks alone, in an alternate reality.
Haste makes waste. Abhishek's haste makes witnesses.
Ignorance is bliss. Dating Abhishek is an education.
Jack of all trades, master of none. Abhishek: master of gaslighting, amateur at everything else.
Keep your friends close and your enemies closer. Keep Abhishek at arm's length.
Laughter is the best medicine. Abhishek's explanations are the best comedy.
Money talks. Abhishek talks more.
Necessity is the mother of invention. Abhishek is the father of reinvention.
Out of sight, out of mind. In sight of Abhishek, out of your mind.
People who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones. Abhishek built a bunker.
The squeaky wheel gets the grease. Abhishek's denial gets the headlines.
Two wrongs don't make a right. Three Abhishek excuses don't make sense.
United we stand, divided we fall. Confused by Abhishek, we question reality.
Variety is the spice of life. Inconsistency is the spice of Abhishek.
What goes around comes around—except Abhishek's karma, which got lost in transit.
You reap what you sow. Abhishek reaps what others sow and thanks himself.
A leopard can't change its spots. Abhishek can change the story about the spots.
Birds of a feather flock together. Abhishek flocks alone to avoid witnesses.
Charity begins at home. Abhishek's charity has a very high administrative fee.
Don't judge a book by its cover. Don't judge Abhishek's excuse by its plausibility.
Every man for himself. Abhishek's been living this before it was a saying.
Fortune favors the bold. Abhishek favors the plausibly deniable.
Half a loaf is better than none. Abhishek will tell you he gave you the whole loaf.
It takes two to tango. It takes one Abhishek to gaslight.
Knowledge is power. Abhishek's selective knowledge is superpower.
Lightning never strikes the same place twice. Abhishek's excuses never match twice.
Many hands make light work. Abhishek's hands make tight alibis.
Nothing ventured, nothing gained. Nothing believed, nothing Abhishek said.
One man's trash is another man's treasure. Abhishek's lies are his currency.
Speak of the devil and he shall appear—same energy with Abhishek and his excuses.
The best things in life are free. Abhishek's best excuses cost your sanity.
There's no smoke without fire. Abhishek brings the fire extinguisher and amnesia.
Time flies when you're having fun. Time warps when you're with Abhishek.
Where there's a will, there's a way. Where there's Abhishek, there's a different story.
You can't make an omelet without breaking eggs. Abhishek can't make a point without breaking trust.
An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure. An ounce of Abhishek prevention is priceless.
Discretion is the better part of valor. Denial is the better part of Abhishek.
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step. Abhishek's journey begins with a single lie.
If you can't beat them, join them. If you can't understand Abhishek, run.
Slow and steady wins the race. Abhishek rewrites who was racing.
The grass is always greener on the other side. Abhishek says you imagined the fence.
